description: Unique system-generated identifier for this fuel transaction record.
Exact date and time the fueling transaction was recorded, likely to the millisecond (YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm).
Local time of the fueling event (HHMMSS).
Indicates the item is a managed inventory part rather than bulk fuel; confirm with SME.
Flags that one or more values (e.g., quantity, meter, cost) are estimated rather than measured.
Marks the fueling as not authorized per policy (e.g., wrong card, driver, or asset).
Flags the reported odometer/hourmeter as suspect or invalid for this transaction.
Transaction date of the fueling event (YYYYMMDD).
Optional free-text notes or description for the fueling entry.
Total amount for the transaction including all taxes and fees.
Variance metric for an alternate MPG calculation; likely a placeholder when unavailable; confirm with SME.
Alternate miles-per-gallon calculation method; values may be placeholders or anomalous; confirm formula with SME.
Variance from expected or baseline MPG for this transaction; confirm calculation method with SME.
Miles per gallon based on distance traveled since last fill divided by fuel quantity dispensed.
Cost attributed to non-fuel fluids (e.g., DEF, oil) associated with this transaction.
Total cost charged for the fueling transaction.
Amount shown on the vendor receipt or billed for the transaction.
Internal cost-per-unit using FIFO inventory valuation for the product dispensed.
Unit price charged by the vendor (e.g., cost per gallon).
Inventory cost applied when drawing fuel from on-hand stock; zero when not applicable.
Volume of fuel dispensed (e.g., gallons or liters).
Secondary distance since previous fill for an alternate meter/calculation; confirm with SME.
Distance traveled since the previous fueling, based on the assetâ€™s meter (units depend on meter type).
Inventory or pump meter reading captured for this transaction; often defaulted when not provided; confirm with SME.
Secondary odometer/hourmeter reading associated with the transaction; often unused; confirm with SME.
Fuel card number used to authorize and pay for the transaction.
Other taxes or fees applied to the transaction not classified as federal or state tax.
Federal fuel tax amount included in the transaction.
State fuel tax amount included in the transaction.
Asset odometer or hourmeter reading at the time of fueling.
Source-system reference or transaction number for the fueling event.
Code representing the fuel product dispensed (e.g., diesel, gasoline).
Reference label used to join or describe the fuel type in reporting; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the supplier or site where the fuel was purchased or dispensed.
Reference label used to join or describe the vendor in reporting; confirm with SME.
Part number for the item dispensed when not standard fuel; 0 when not applicable.
Reference label used to join or describe the part in reporting; confirm with SME.
Organizational hierarchy code (level 9) attributed to the transaction (e.g., department/division).
Reference label used to join or describe hierarchy level 9 in reporting; confirm with SME.
Organizational hierarchy code (level 1) attributed to the transaction.
Reference label used to join or describe hierarchy level 1 in reporting; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the employee responsible for or associated with the fueling transaction.
Reference label used to join or describe the employee in reporting; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the equipment/vehicle that was fueled.
Reference label used to join or describe the equipment in reporting; confirm with SME.
Recorded fuel tank capacity for the equipment on this transaction; likely defaulted when unknown; confirm with SME.
Original unique identifier from a legacy system, retained for traceability.
Name of the legacy source table from which this record originated.
External transaction number from the processor or POS system; may be blank when unavailable.
Dispenser hose identifier used during fueling; confirm coding with SME.
Pump or dispenser number used for the fueling event.
Identifier of the storage tank from which the fuel was drawn; applicable for on-site fueling.
Location or site identifier where the fueling occurred.
Inventory cost applied when the item is treated as non-stock; confirm usage with SME.
Variance metric for a fourth MPG calculation or period; confirm definition with SME.
Fourth MPG metric (e.g., rolling average or alternate method); confirm formula with SME.
Variance metric for a third MPG calculation or period; confirm definition with SME.
Third MPG metric (e.g., rolling average or alternate method); confirm formula with SME.
Distance associated with the fourth meter or MPG calculation; confirm with SME.
Distance associated with the third meter or MPG calculation; confirm with SME.
Fourth meter reading captured for alternate calculations; confirm meter type with SME.
Third meter reading captured for alternate calculations; confirm meter type with SME.
Indicates the record was imported from an external interface rather than entered manually.
Posting date when the transaction was posted to accounting or ERP; may be blank.
Organizational hierarchy code (level 2) attributed to the transaction.
Reference label used to join or describe hierarchy level 2 in reporting; confirm with SME.
